Sequence Information.Peptide Name: DFT564 (Synthetic AMPs, DFT503 variant, Leu-rich; XXA, UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is poorly similar (92.31%) toDFT561. L: 62%.Chemical modification:  C-terminal amidation.Activity: Active against S. aureus USA300 (MIC 6.2 uM), P-aeruginosa PAO1 (MIC > 25 uM), E-coli ATCC 25922 (MIC> 25 uM), and K-pneumonia ATCC13883 (MIC > 25 uM).Toxicity:  human RBC HC50 >300 uM, much less hemo.lytic.Structure:  NMR studies revealed helical structure bound to SDS micelles.Animal model:mouse:  In contrast to DFT503 and DFT561, DFT564 and DFT565 didn't show systemic in vivo efficacy due to high cationicity (i.p./i.p.).
Literature Information.Author: Mishra B, Lakshmaiah Narayana J, Lushnikova T, Wang X, Wang G. 2019
Literature Information.Reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 2019 Jul 2;116(27):13517-13522. doi: 10.1073/pnas.1821410116.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Low cationicity is important for systemic in vivo efficacy of database-derived peptides against drug-resistant Gram-positive pathogens
